The Iraqi government is trying to renegotiate a deal with the U.S. regarding the status of U.S. troops in Iraq. The main elements of the plan had been worked out between the two parties. However, after facing political opposition in Iraq, Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki has changed his mind on the plan and has now drawn up a new draft deal. The new agreement would call for the complete removal of all U.S. troops from Iraq by 2011, in three years.
